newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-NANTES CLIMB TO FIFTH WITH 1-0 WIN AT RENNES.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-NANTES CLIMB TO FIFTH WITH 1-0 WIN AT RENNES.

text.p: Nantes extended their unbeaten run in the French first division to 20 matches on Friday with a 1-0 win that ended Rennes' 12-match sequence without a home defeat.
Striker Jocelyn Gourvennec scored in the 69th minute, his ninth goal of the season, from a pass from the left by Japhet N'Doram as Nantes, champions two years ago, climbed to fifth in the standings.
Nantes' steady rise after a dismal start to the season is due in part to the fine form of their teenage goalkeeper Mickael Landreau, now unbeaten in his 18 first division games.
Landreau made a crucial save from a header by Rennes captain Patrice Carteron in the first half.

He was lucky when, in the 63rd minute, Rennes' Scottish striker Alan Johston put the ball wide from a cross from the left by Stephane Guivarc'h, the leading marksman in the first division who has scored 17 of his team's 30 goals.
Lyon were held 0-0 at home by Lens, whose point lifted them two places to 14th, at least for 24 hours until Saturday's eight matches.
Substitute Tony Vairelles hit the bar for Lens, while Lyon's Polish defender Jasek Bak had a goal disallowed when he turned the ball into the Lens net with his fist.
Monaco defend their seven-point lead at the top of the table away to Metz.
